alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 31 at 1:11PM PST until December 31 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in California...Nevada... West Fork Carson River At Woodfords affecting Alpine and Douglas Counties. For the West Fork Carson River...including Woodfords...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...West Fork Carson River At Woodfords. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Monitoring Stage. No flooding occurs. However, residents along the West Fork Carson River should be prepared for flooding if there are additional rises expected due to snowmelt and/or rainfall runoff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:20 PM PST Saturday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.8 feet late this afternoon. - Action stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood stage is 13.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM PST.
